meanings.definition: Behaving or characteristic of a sycophant.
meanings.sent1: Her sycophantish behavior towards the boss was obvious to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The student's sycophantish attitude towards the teacher earned him special favors.
meanings.sent3: In a sycophantish move, he constantly praised his friend to gain favor.
meanings.sent4: The politician's sycophantish actions towards the wealthy donors were shameless.
meanings.sent5: The sycophantish flattery was so excessive that it made others uncomfortable.

meanings.sent1: The sycophantish smile on her face revealed her true intentions.
meanings.sent2: His sycophantish behavior towards authority figures was off-putting.
meanings.sent3: He tried to imitate the sycophantish gestures of the courtiers but failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The sycophantish tone of his voice grated on everyone's nerves.
meanings.sent5: The sycophantish flattery was so transparent that no one believed it.

meanings.definition: Inclined to act like a sycophant.
meanings.sent1: She felt sycophantish around influential people, always seeking their approval.
meanings.sent2: His sycophantish tendencies made him agree with everything his superiors said.
meanings.sent3: In a moment of sycophantish weakness, he praised his boss excessively.
meanings.sent4: The sycophantish behavior of the new intern was immediately noticed.
meanings.sent5: His sycophantish nature became evident when he started echoing his manager's opinions.
